title: Arco Filtro vs Arco Preciso
comparison_intro: Both are stepless grinders built for people who care about what ends up in the cup. The Filtro is optimised for filter brewing methods with a wider grind range and burr geometry tuned for clarity. The Preciso is built for espresso with the fine-resolution adjustment that espresso demands. Choosing between them depends on what you brew most.
hero_image_alt: Arco Filtro and Arco Preciso grinders on a wooden countertop, the Filtro next to a Chemex and V60 dripper, the Preciso next to a bottomless portafilter and espresso cup, morning light, clean composition showing their different brewing contexts

boiler_type.product_a: N/A — Stepless flat burr grinder optimised for filter (54 mm burrs, filter geometry)
boiler_type.product_b: N/A — Stepless flat burr grinder optimised for espresso (54 mm burrs, espresso geometry)

grind_compatibility.product_a: Wide range from medium-fine (Aeropress) to coarse (French Press), with excellent consistency across the full spectrum
grind_compatibility.product_b: Focused range from Turkish-fine to medium, with exceptional resolution in the espresso zone

suitable_for.product_a: Pour-over enthusiasts, Aeropress users, French Press brewers, and anyone whose primary method is filter coffee
suitable_for.product_b: Espresso-focused home baristas who need micro-adjustability in the fine grind range

not_suitable_for.product_a: Dedicated espresso drinkers — the Filtro can grind fine enough for espresso but lacks the micro-resolution the Preciso offers in that range
not_suitable_for.product_b: Filter-focused brewers — the Preciso can grind coarse enough for pour-over but the adjustment feel is cramped outside the espresso range

craft-barista.rationale: If espresso is your primary focus, the Preciso's resolution in the fine range is where it matters — the Filtro's broader range comes at the cost of precision where you need it most.

morning-minimalist.rationale: If your morning is a pour-over or an Aeropress, the Filtro is designed for exactly that — consistent grind across the methods you actually use.

upgrader.rationale: If you are upgrading your espresso setup, the Preciso is the grinder that will make the biggest difference in your cup — the Filtro is a better second grinder than a first one.

verdict: The Filtro and Preciso are specialist tools, not competitors. The Filtro excels at filter grind consistency across a wide range of methods and is the better choice if pour-over or immersion brewing is your daily ritual. The Preciso excels at the surgical fine adjustments espresso demands. If you brew both espresso and filter regularly, many of our customers end up owning both — and that is not an upsell, it is genuinely the best solution.
